posts.title: While You Wait For The Girl On the Train, Why Not Try…
posts.text: If you are looking for something to read while you wait patiently for Paula Hawkins's bestseller, why not try one of these other psychologically suspenseful novels.

posts.title: While You Wait For "Redeployment" Why Not Try...
posts.text: Phil Klay's Redeployment is a National Book Award–winning collection of stories about soldiers grappling with the harsh realities of war. It is currently in high demand, so while you wait for your hold to arrive you might be interested in one of the following similar titles.

posts.title: A Crocheter's Delight
posts.text: Frigid temperatures are upon us, and that means one thing: keeping warm.  How about foregoing  the costly department store prices and creating your own awesome scarves, fuzzy socks and warm mittens.  All you need are two hands, a couple balls of yarn, needle(s), a comfortable chair and a bit of free time.

posts.title: While You Wait For "Yes Please" Why Not Try...
posts.text: Like Yes Please by Amy Poehler , these humorous and engaging memoirs transform readers into the personal and professional lives of celebrities. Some titles also incorporate advice.

posts.title: While You Wait For "Station Eleven" Why Not Try...
posts.text: Like Station Eleven by Emily St. John Mandel, these post-apocalyptic novels take readers on compelling journeys of lost worlds, lost lives, and survival.

posts.title: While You Wait For "The Orphan Train" Why Not Try…
posts.text: Like The Orphan Train, by Christina Baker Kline, these moving, character-driven titles delve into the subjects of orphans, foster care, family issues, unexpected friendships, secrets, rediscovery and the promise of second chances.

posts.title: While You Wait For "The Vacationers," Why Not Try...
posts.text: These character-driven titles portray characters dealing with family issues and relationships, friendships, long buried secrets, journeys into the past and life changing events.
